timeline.message: Prevent NumberFormatException when entering filter values with leading or trailing whitespaces in task filter

timeline.bodyText:
parseInt is throwing an NumberFormatException if tempId does not contain a parsable integer. See https://docs.oracle.com/javase/8/docs/api/java/lang/Integer.html#parseInt-java.lang.String-
Maybe you should catch this exception and do not add this value to the list in this case?
timeline.author: henning-gerhardt

replies.bodyText:
AFAIK in Java the idiom of "look before you leap" is preferred over willingly risking and catching exceptions, which would probably be a more "pythonic" way to deal with exceptions (see https://docs.python.org/3.5/glossary.html#term-eafp).
So I guess you are right that different potential reasons for NumberFormatExceptions should be prevented, but I would prefer doing that by explicitly testing whether a String is numeric or not instead of willingly provoking an Exception in Java.
Please check if you can agree with my updated changes.
replies.author: solth

replies.bodyText: Your last change (from !tempId.isEmpty() to !tempId.isEmpty() && StringUtils.isNumeric(tempId)) is ok for me.
replies.author: henning-gerhardt

timeline.message: Add explicit check whether non-empty filter string is numeric or not
